actions.text: QUESTION OF PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE - Mr. Michel rose to a question of the privileges of the House, offered a resolution, and asked for its immediate consideration. The Chair subsequently ruled that the resolution met the requirements for constituting a question of the privileges of the House.

MOTION TO REFER - Mr. Gephardt moved to refer the resolution to the Committee on the Judiciary. Mr. Michel offered a privileged motion to order the previous question on the resolution. The Chair put the question on the motion to order the previous question and declared that by voice vote the Noes appeared to have it.

DIVISION VOTE - Mr. Michel requested a division vote on the motion to order the previous question. The Chair announced the results by division to be 21 Ayes to 10 Noes. Mr. Gephardt objected to the division vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. The Chair declared that a quorum was obviously not present and the Yeas and Nays were ordered on the motion to order the previous question.
On ordering the previous question Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 203 - 204 (Roll no. 37).
The previous question on the resolution not having been ordered, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to refer the resolution to the Committee on the Judiciary.
The previous question on the motion to refer to the Committee on the Judiciary was ordered without objection
On motion to refer Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 176 - 233 (Roll No. 38).
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 309 - 101 (Roll no. 39).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Relating to a question of privilege of the House.

summary.text: Directs the General Counsel to the Clerk of the House of Representatives to withdraw from the U.S. Supreme Court the Brief (regarding the constitutionality of a certain statute for flag protection) for the Speaker and Leadership Group of the U.S. House of Representatives in Support of Jurisdictional Statements pending a full and proper review by the Bipartisan Legal Advisory Group.

titles.title: Relating to a question of privilege of the House.
